content.description: Burly route overall, best part is that the hardest move is the last. Missing the last move means a solid whipper. Very overhanging so relatively safe to go for broke. Would recommend taking a couple of extended draws to make clipping positions more efficient. Also when cleaning don't pull the last draw or you'll send yourself and the belayer flying off into the woods like some redneck cirque du soleil acrobatic nightmare. Just pull it with a stick clip after getting to the ground.
content.location: Bolted line trending left, roughly 20 feet of overhang. Small stream running from right to left at the base of the climb.

content.description: Largely unclimbed area for the mills. There's some excellent harder climbs, mostly overhanging and the only sport routes in the park that I know of. The Bob Value Guidebook is worth the buy for being able to track down theses secluded routes.
